title: How to Dilate or Shrink Your Pupils on Command

steps.title: Imagine a dark room.
steps.content: Imagine a dark room. Research in 2014 showed that people can sometimes dilate their pupils by imagining dark shapes or dark scenes. [2] X Research source Think of something like black bears assaulting a black campground at midnight, and your eyes may widen temporarily.

steps.title: Focus on distant objects or unfocus your eyes.
steps.content: Focus on distant objects or unfocus your eyes. Your pupils will get bigger as your eyes adjust to a further viewing distance. [3] X Research source Another way to approach this is to suddenly unfocus your eyes, blurring your vision as much as you can. If you're doing this correctly, your eyes will feel very relaxed; if you start to see double, you've probably crossed your eyes and need to start over. With these techniques, you won't be able to observe your own eyes, so you'll need to record yourself or have a friend watch.

steps.title: Face a darker part of the room.
steps.content: Face a darker part of the room. As you probably know, pupils grow to let in more light. [4] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you aren't able to dim the surrounding lighting, you can still dilate your pupils by turning to face away from windows and light source.

steps.title: Picture something that gives you an adrenaline rush.
steps.content: Picture something that gives you an adrenaline rush . Your pupils can dilate dramatically when you are excited, or especially when sexually stimulated, due to the release of oxytocin and adrenaline. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source In addition to dilated pupils, these chemicals also cause your mind to race, muscles to tense up, and breathing and heart rate to go faster. [6] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Through biofeedback, people can learn to “drive” your adrenaline levels up or down.

steps.title: Use allergy eye drops
steps.content: Use allergy eye drops containing tetrahydrozoline. Pick up some over-the-counter eye drops intended to be used to treat allergies. These may cause your eyes to become dilated as one of the potential side effects of tetrahydrozoline is a mild widening of the pupils. [7] X Research source Be sure to read the instructions, and never use more drops than the label recommends.

steps.title: Drink an espresso
steps.content: Drink an espresso or take decongestants. Stimulants that work on the sympathetic nervous system can trigger your iris muscles to dilate your pupils. These include caffeine, ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, and phenylephrine. [8] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source [9] X Research source The last three are found in most over-the-counter decongestants. [10] X Research source Warning: Do not consume more than the recommended dose of any decongestant for the purpose of dilating your eyes. Side effects include drowsiness, irritation in the lining of your nose, headaches, nausea, dry mouth, restlessness, and a rash. [11] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source

steps.title: Consider 5-HTP supplements.
steps.content: Consider 5-HTP supplements. This is an over-the-counter drug you can find at pharmacies or anywhere that sells health supplements. While 5-HTP is generally safe, too high a dosage can cause dangerous effects from “serotonin syndrome” . [12] X Research source Stick within the recommended dosage, and avoid 5-HTP entirely if you are on LSD, cocaine, antidepressants, large B-vitamin doses, or other substances that increase serotonin levels. [13] X Research source Warning: Do not begin a new supplement without consulting your doctor (particularly if you're taking other medications).

steps.title: Avoid other substances unless recommended by a doctor.
steps.content: Avoid other substances unless recommended by a doctor. Some prescription eye drops can dilate pupils, but have serious side effects that should be weighed by a doctor. [14] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source If you are going through methadone treatment or have a medical condition that constricts your pupils, ask your doctor for advice on how to counteract this. Some recreational drugs cause dilated pupils as well. [15] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source These are illegal in most areas, and can come with additional health risks if combined with other substances that cause dilated or constricted pupils.

steps.title: Look at a bright, natural light.
steps.content: Look at a bright, natural light. Stare at a bright window for a couple seconds. This will cause your pupils to shrink immediately. [16] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you're outside, step into a patch of sunlight, rather than staying in the shadows. While light bulbs will work as well, natural light is more effective. Never look directly at the sun, as this could damage your eyes.

steps.title: Focus intently on something close to you.
steps.content: Focus intently on something close to you. Your pupils will narrow as you change your focus to something in front of your face. [17] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source You can start by closing one eye and placing your finger in front of the open one. With practice, you can learn to focus your eyes close even when there's nothing there.

steps.title: Consider medication.
steps.content: Consider medication. There are a variety of medications used to constrict the pupil, but these are usually only available as a prescription or must be administered by a doctor. [18] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source Opioids constrict pupils, but most examples are illegal in most countries. [19] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source They can also cause serious harm, especially when combined with other drugs that cause pupil constriction or dilation.
